intro: Fimbristylis arnottii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along waterways. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Fimbristylis arnottii plays an important role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
